a real or complex scalar, vector or matrix.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: atan(x) computes the 2-quadrant inverse tangent, which is the inverse of tan(phi). For real x, phi is in the interval \left(\dfrac{-\pi}{2}, \dfrac{\pi}{2}\right). For complex x, atan has two singular, branching points +%i, -%i and the chosen branch cuts are the two imaginary half-straight lines [i, i*\infty) and (-i*\infty, -i].
In case of vector or matrix arguments, the evaluation is done element-wise, so that phi is a vector or matrix of the same size with phi(i, j) = atan(x(i, j)).

refsection.title: Examples
refsection.programlisting:
// Branch cuts atan(-%eps + 2*%i) atan(+%eps + 2*%i) atan(-%eps - 2*%i) atan(+%eps - 2*%i)
// Values at the branching points ieee(2) atan(%i) atan(-%i)
